body.p: To His Excellency Thos E. Bramlet Governor of the State of Kentucky

The undersigned petitioners citizens of Boone County represent that of the august Election in 1865 James McFullitone & M R Johnson were Judges, of said election at the Bigham Precinct in said county that said judges refused to allow John Doyle Geo M McManamo & James Murphy ^to vote^ on the ground that they were not citizens under the act of expatriation of March 1862 and that said judges were for said refusal to allow then said Doyle, McManamo Murphy ^to vote^ indicted by the Grand Jury of said County at the Spt Term 1865
In the case of Murphy the only one of those cases tried there was a hung Jury

They believe that to the feelings on the just of those in sympathy with the rebellion toward a union man and especially towards union men who have acted as offices of elections it is not probable that the cases can he disposed of or that justice will be done towards any of said offices

They therefore believe these cases present a case for executive interposition & ask your Excellency to interpose & release the said Judge who they beleave acted consciensiously in the discharge of their duty from the effects of said Indictements

They further state that said Judges together with Lt Thos J McHattan of the 55th Ky request also indicted the two judges for ordering
the erasure of the name of John N Gunerly who had offered to note & whose name was made but no the note therefore not counted because of the to swear when requested by the judges
For the reasons herein before named the asked of said judges & McHattan be also endorsed & the endorsement
